result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard Dushan Talbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.
- Pay supervision fees.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
- Batterers Intervention Program. Court will allow agent to decide on lifting NO CONTACT ORDER after completion.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard Dushan Talbert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.   Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, consecutive to 20CF4179, with credit for 62 days served. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Batters intervention program.  Court will allow agent to decide on lifting no contact order after completion.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA and DV surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court sets restitution at $0.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she must submit a DNA sample and may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4, AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.
Received and Filed. Elements of the Offense
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
At the request of the parties, the jury trial date on 3-4-22 at 8:30 am is converted to a plea and sentencing hearing.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Howard Dushan Talbert not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is joined with 20CF4179.  Case is adjourned to 3-14-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LMR
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in court with Attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer. D. Stachoviak. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  This hearing will be streamed live on DAcast:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Howard Dushan Talbert in court.  
Atty. Michael Plaisted appeared as a friend of the court.
Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court appoints Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Plaisted accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the a rate to be determined at a later date. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled on 1/20/22 at 1:30 pm.
